Down, busy Memory, down—</br>Others with pleasure in their looks</br>See the fresh meads and silver brooks,</br>And hail the happy town.</br>Me with a cruel strength</br>You force, O tyrant, thro' the length</br>Of many a scene, and many an image dear;</br>You from my bosom's depth demand the sigh,</br>Demand, the tribute of the gliding tear,</br>And hold the landscape to an aching eye.

Ah!  rather, where no sorrows weep,</br>With thee, Oblivion, let me sleep,</br>In fast enchantment bound;</br>Where, thro' th' impenetrable night,</br>No gleam can reach the trembling sight,</br>The ear no accent wound;</br>Where through the pathless wild no track remains,</br>But thy own Lethe creeps, and sullen silence reigns.

Yet tho' remembrance scorns to bless,</br>And leaves me, O Forgetfulness,</br>To court thy leaden sway;</br>A gentler, a diviner maid,</br>Prepar'd to lend her lenient aid,</br>Recalls me to the realms of day.</br>For she — the friend of pensive minds—</br>The friend of every Muse;</br>The nymph that scatters sorrows to the winds,</br>That dips her mantle in the rainbow's hues;</br>That borrows for her crest Aurora's star;</br>She (while the gayest zephyrs waft her car),</br>She comes — fair FANCY comes — diffus'd around,</br>The violets sweetly breathe, and sweet is music's sound.
And now the rapid tide is felt</br>Of spirits that recal</br>The play that erst with childhood dwelt,</br>In bower or in hall:
The sport that wak'd with youth the grove,</br>Or frolick'd on the green,</br>When, whilom, all the warmth was love,</br>And all the feeling keen:
The glee when sprightly Friendship's glow</br>Gave relish to the bowl,</br>And mirth at high convivial flow</br>Was banquet to the soul.
The prospect now its charms regains;</br>For midst the flash of joy,</br>In spite a moment of his pains,</br>The Greybeard is the Boy.</br>
